intro: Lepidadenia grisea, commonly known as the gray lepidadenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, pale green to grayish leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
